company.name: The Receivable Management Services Corporation
company.business_description: The Receivable Management Services Corporation is a collection agency that transfers personal data internationally and participates in privacy frameworks.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: The Receivable Management Services Corporation, a Delaware-based collection agency, claimed to be a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework on its website from February 2009 until November 2013. However, the company failed to renew its Safe Harbor self-certification in February 2010, and Commerce updated its status to 'not current.' Despite this, the company continued to display the Safe Harbor certification mark and make claims about its Safe Harbor participation for nearly four years after its certification lapsed.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be registered with the U.S. Department of Commerce's Safe Harbor program and to adhere to the U.S. Safe Harbor principles
representations_made.quoted_text: RMS is registered with the U.S. Department of Commerce’s Safe Harbor program, and adheres to the U.S. Safe Harbor principles of Notice, Choice, Onward Transfer, Security, Data Integrity, Access, and Enforcement as defined by the agency…

representations_made.description: Displayed the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework Certification Mark on its website
representations_made.quoted_text: 13. From at least February 2009 until November 2013, respondent displayed the mark on the www.rmsna.com website.

representations_made.description: Represented that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: 14. Through the means described in Paragraphs 12 and 13, respondent represented, expressly or by implication, that it was a “current” participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claims
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it was a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework through statements on its website and display of the Safe Harbor certification mark
counts.fact: From February 2010 until November 2013, respondent was not a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework because it did not renew its self-certification in February 2010
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representations set forth in Paragraph 14 are false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: The Receivable Management Services Corporation and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, compliance with, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection and copying all documents relating to compliance with this order for a period of five years from the date of preparation or dissemination, whichever is later.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the FTC all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation
requirements.quoted_text: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain and make available to the FTC any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent's compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with responsibilities relating to the subject matter of the order and secure signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver this order to current principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order within thirty days after service of this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order. Respondent shall deliver this order to such current personnel within thirty (30) days after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person

requirements.description: Deliver this order to future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order within thirty days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in

requirements.description: For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, deliver this order at least ten days prior to the change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this

requirements.description: Secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section
requirements.quoted_text: structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, bankruptcy filing, or change in corporate name or address.

requirements.description: Notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: If respondent learns of a proposed change fewer than thirty days prior to the date such action is to take place, notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a true and accurate written report with the Commission detailing the manner and form of its compliance with this order within sixty days after service of the order, and submit additional reports within ten days of receipt of written notice from the Commission.

requirements.description: File with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent, and its successors and assigns, within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this

requirements.description: Submit an additional true and accurate written report within ten days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.

requirements.description: Order remains in effect until June 19, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on June 19, 2034, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
